title: fanoutqa: What are the five largest countries by population and what is the largest city in each of those countries? (21b5a69403eeda11)

In 2021, Shanghai was the most expensive city in the world.[136] Shanghai was the 5th wealthiest city in the world, with a total wealth amounts to $1.8 trillion,[137] and Shanghai was ranked fifth-highest in the number of billionaires by Forbes.[138] Shanghai's nominal GDP was projected to reach US$1.3 trillion in 2035 (ranking first in China), making it one of the world's Top 5 major cities in terms of GRP according to a study by Oxford Economics.[139] As of August 2022, Shanghai ranked 5th in the world and 2nd in China (after Beijing) by the largest number of the *Fortune* Global 500 companies in the world.[140]

<fragment>

As of 2022[update], Shanghai had a total population of 24,758,900, including 14,693,630 (59.3%) hukou holders (registered locally).[142] As of 2021[update], 89.3% of Shanghai's population live in urban areas, and 10.7% live in rural areas.[11] Based on the population of its total administrative area, Shanghai is the second largest of the four municipalities of China, behind Chongqing, but is generally considered the largest Chinese city because the urban population of Chongqing is much smaller.[171] According to the OECD, Shanghai's metropolitan area has an estimated population of 34 million.[172]


According to the Shanghai Municipal Statistics Bureau, about 157,900 residents in Shanghai are foreigners, including 28,900 Japanese, 21,900 Americans and 20,800 Koreans.[173] The actual number of foreign citizens in the city is probably much higher.[174] Shanghai is also a domestic immigration city—40.3% (9.8 million) of the city's residents are from other regions of China.[142]


</fragment>

chat_history.name: search

chat_history.content:
Based on current global data, here are the five most populous countries and their largest cities:

1. China (Population: ~1.4 billion)
   Largest city: Shanghai (24.9 million in the city proper, 34 million metro area)

2. India (Population: ~1.4 billion)
   Largest city: Mumbai (approximately 20 million metro area)

3. United States (Population: ~332 million)
   Largest city: New York City (approximately 8.8 million city proper, 20 million metro area)

4. Indonesia (Population: ~274 million)
   Largest city: Jakarta (approximately 10.5 million city proper, over 30 million metro area)

5. Pakistan (Population: ~220 million)
   Largest city: Karachi (approximately 15 million city proper)

These population figures are approximate and constantly changing. The metropolitan area populations may vary depending on how the boundaries are defined. It's worth noting that in some cases, there can be debate about which city is the largest, as different measurements (city proper vs. metropolitan area) can yield different results. For example, in China, while Shanghai is generally considered the largest city, Guangzhou-Foshan and Beijing also have very large metropolitan populations.

functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.
